title: Exclusive: China's customs agents told Nvidia's H200 chips are not permitted, sources say
description: Chinese customs authorities told customs agents this week that Nvidia's H200 artificial intelligence chips are not permitted to enter China, according to three people briefed on the matter.
content:
Chinese government officials also summoned domestic technology companies to meetings on Tuesday where they were explicitly instructed not to purchase the chips unless necessary, two of the people and a third source said.

title: Britain seeks 'reset' in copyright battle between AI and creators
description: British technology minister Liz Kendall said on Tuesday the government was seeking a “reset” on ‍plans to overhaul copyright rules to accommodate artificial intelligence
content:
British technology minister Liz Kendall said on Tuesday the government was seeking a “reset” on ‍plans to overhaul copyright rules to accommodate artificial intelligence, pledging ​to protect creators while unlocking AI’s economic potential.

title: Modi to Open Historic Commonwealth Parliamentary Conference
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to inaugurate the 28th Conference of Speakers and Presiding Officers of the Commonwealth. The conference will focus on essential parliamentary matters such as the integration of artificial intelligence in parliamentary functions and the impact of social media on legislators.
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the 28th Conference of Speakers and Presiding Officers of the Commonwealth (CSPOC) on Thursday. The event, chaired by Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, promises to be a significant gathering with 61 speakers and... [738 chars]

title: Positive" Framework to Prevent AI from Overwhelming Global Power Grids
description: The World Economic Forum has unveiled a strategic blueprint aimed at transforming artificial intelligence from a significant energy consumer into a cornerstone of global sustainability. A report titled 'From Paradox to Progress,' the framework addresses a looming crisis: the rapid expansion of AI is driving a massive surge in electricity demand that threatens to outpace the growth of renewable energy.

title: Oxford researchers developing phone and AI diagnostic tool
description: An Oxford academic is looking into how smartphones and artificial intelligence could help diagnose rare brain conditions.
content:
Researchers at the University of Oxford are developing a tool to diagnose progressive supranuclear palsy (PSP) and corticobasal degeneration (CBD), with support from a £24,312 grant from the PSP Association (PSPA).
